definition: Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: It is a cross-border international river.
sentences.chinese: 是一条跨越国界的河流。

sentences.english: During the Spring and Autumn Period(770-476BC), there were two famous senior officials in the State of Yue.
sentences.chinese: 范蠡和文仲是春秋时期越国的两个大官。

sentences.english: Spring and Autumn period, Longwan become more jurisdiction in the country.
sentences.chinese: 春秋战国时期，龙湾成为越国辖地。

sentences.english: In other words, this palace is the palace of South Vietnam in accordance with the construction of the Han.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，这座宫殿是南越国按照汉皇宫建造地。

sentences.english: He wants to move to the country.
Nanyue Kingdom was an important regional regime in Lingnan in late Qin and early Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 南越国是秦末汉初存在于岭南地区的重要地方政权。

sentences.english: Their army is poorly trained, unable to withstand a single blow.
sentences.chinese: 越国的军队也缺乏训练，不堪一击。

sentences.english: One day after consultations they decided to go to the state of Yue to earn a livelihood.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他们商量想到越国去谋生。

sentences.english: He added, "We now have a transnational media."
sentences.chinese: 他补充说，“我们现在有一个跨越国界的媒体。

sentences.english: Three years later, Gou Jian was set free and returned to the State of Yue.
sentences.chinese: 三年以后，勾践终于被释放回了越国。

sentences.english: The Kingdom of Yue surrendered as it was losing the war with the Kingdom of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 越国在和吴国的战争中失败了，向吴国投降。

sentences.english: By its nature, humor crosses conventional boundaries and breaks patterns. Creativity often does the same.
sentences.chinese: 就其性质而言，幽默常规跨越国界和休息模式。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, as Fuchai’s kingdom declined, Yue grew rich and raised a new army.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，当夫差的王国每况愈下，越国则富国强兵。

sentences.english: Many years later, he was set free.
sentences.chinese: 几年以后，勾践被放回越国。

sentences.english: Several years later, he was set free.
sentences.chinese: 几年以后，勾践被放回越国。

definition: Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸/also called 吳王闔廬|吴王阖庐
King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC)/also called 闔廬|阖庐
Fan Li (536-488 BC), politician of Yue state, businessman and economist
vassal state
to defend one's country
state of Wei (c. 1040-209 BC), vassal of Zhou
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
